source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves compound, terminal leaflet modified into 1 or more tendrils
Leaves reduced to a grass-like phyllode, tendril absent
Stems and petioles winged, at least in upper parts; stipules more than 2 mm wide; flowers 1-many; corolla more than 10 mm long; pod more than 5 mm wide
Stems and petioles not winged; stipules less than 2 mm wide; flowers 1 or rarely 2; corolla to c. 10 mm long; pod usually less than 5 mm wide
Plant annual; flowers mostly 1–3; calyx-lobes more or less equal
Plant perennial; flowers 3–15 in racemes; calyx-lobes unequal
Peduncles mostly more than 7 cm long; pods not winged
Peduncles mostly less than 6 cm long; pods with 2 wings on upper suture
Calyx pubescent, teeth longer than tube; pod pubescent
Calyx glabrous, teeth shorter than tube; pod glabrous
